text: East Liberty is a coming-of-age novel by the American writer Joseph Bathanti. Set in the 1950s and 1960s in the Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, Italian-American neighborhood of East Liberty, it tells the story of Bobby Renzo, who is raised by his unwed mother and who feels called to the Roman Catholic priesthood. ==See also== Everyday People (novel) ==References== Category:2001 American novels Category:Italian-American culture in Pittsburgh Category:Italian- American novels Category:Novels set in Pittsburgh Category:Fiction set in the 1950s Category:Fiction set in the 1960s Category:American bildungsromans Category:Catholic novels Category:2001 debut novels
title: East Liberty (novel)
